content.description: It is easiest to approach this clib by contouring along the top of Rose Hill Crag until reaching the end of it.  (Before cobweb cliffs in Sqeezing the Lemmon).  Hike down here and hang a left along the cliff.  Soon you will encounter a small cove with two short climbs.  The furthest one in is The Swingers.  The climb is very short on large holds with the hardest moves near the top.
content.location: Left of Sunburn Cliff in Pine Cove.

content.description:
Awesome laybacks on variable rock.  Unfortunately also a good example of unnecessary bolting.  We were able to lead this on gear, getting a good placement within arms reach of every single bolt.   

  Try leading it both ways, first with bolts, then with gear.  Or practice placing gear on layback.
content.location: Between Drillers in the Mist and Black Stain.

content.description: This is the left most route as you face Sunburn Cliff.  Climb overlaps to chain anchor

Sunburn Cliff is part of the Willow Canyon Crags North, as described in SQL II.  There are several other crags in close proximity, all hosting mixed routes in the 5.9-5.11 range.  Most routes are bolted, but some require the odd piece of gear.
